question.body: Which of the following are functions of the lymphatic system? (choose all that are correct). (note I would like to have more than one correct answer that they can choose.

multiple_choice.choice: Pick up excess fluids and return to the blood.
Produce cells to defend the body from pathogens via the specific defense system.
Transport amino acids from the digestive system to body cells
Contributes to the body's nonspecific defenses by causing a fever and inflammation.

response.feedback: Yes, everyday fluid is lost from capillary networks and the lymphatic system returns this
Yes, the lympatic system produces and trains cells such as T and B cells which protect the body.
No, the lymphatic system transports lipids not amino acids.
Yes, the specific defenses are important for protecting the body against a variety of pathogens.

part.hint: The lymphatic system is important to transport and defense of the body.
